title: Quick Inventory of Depressive Symptomatology (QIDS-SR-16)
description: Assesses depressive symptoms by self-report using 16 items covering the 9 DSM-IV depression criterion symptom domains. This validated instrument evaluates depression severity over the prior 7 days and is used for screening, monitoring treatment response, and research applications.

parameters.name: sleep_onset
parameters.description: Falling asleep - rate difficulty falling asleep over the past 7 days
options: 0 - Never takes longer than 30 minutes to fall asleep
1 - Takes at least 30 minutes to fall asleep, less than half the time
2 - Takes at least 30 minutes to fall asleep, more than half the time
3 - Takes more than 60 minutes to fall asleep, more than half the time

parameters.name: sleep_maintenance
parameters.description: Sleep during the night - rate sleep disturbances during the night over the past 7 days
options: 0 - Does not wake up at night
1 - Restless, light sleep with few awakenings
2 - Wakes up at least once a night, but goes back to sleep easily
3 - Awakens more than once a night and stays awake for 20 minutes or more

parameters.name: early_awakening
parameters.description: Waking up too early - rate early morning awakening over the past 7 days
options: 0 - Less than half the time, awakens no more than 30 minutes before necessary
1 - More than half the time, awakens more than 30 minutes before necessary
2 - Awakens at least one hour before necessary, more than half the time
3 - Awakens at least two hours before necessary, more than half the time

parameters.name: hypersomnia
parameters.description: Sleeping too much - rate excessive sleep over the past 7 days
options: 0 - Sleeps no longer than 7-8 hours/night, without naps
1 - Sleeps no longer than 10 hours in a 24-hour period
2 - Sleeps no longer than 12 hours in a 24-hour period
3 - Sleeps longer than 12 hours in a 24-hour period

parameters.name: sad_mood
parameters.description: Feeling sad - rate feelings of sadness over the past 7 days
options: 0 - Does not feel sad
1 - Feels sad less than half the time
2 - Feels sad more than half the time
3 - Feels sad nearly all of the time

parameters.name: appetite_decrease
parameters.description: Decreased appetite - rate appetite decrease over the past 7 days
options: 0 - No change in usual appetite
1 - Eats somewhat less often or lesser amounts
2 - Eats much less than usual and only with personal effort
3 - Rarely eats within a 24-hour period, and only with extreme personal effort or persuasion

parameters.name: appetite_increase
parameters.description: Increased appetite - rate appetite increase over the past 7 days
options: 0 - No change in usual appetite
1 - More frequently feels a need to eat than usual
2 - Regularly eats more often and/or greater amounts than usual
3 - Feels driven to overeat both at mealtime and between meals

parameters.name: weight_decrease
parameters.description: Decreased weight - rate weight loss over the past 7 days
options: 0 - No change in weight
1 - Feels as if some slight weight loss
2 - Has lost 2 pounds or more
3 - Has lost 5 pounds or more

parameters.name: weight_increase
parameters.description: Increased weight - rate weight gain over the past 7 days
options: 0 - No change in weight
1 - Feels as if some slight weight gain
2 - Has gained 2 pounds or more
3 - Has gained 5 pounds or more

parameters.name: concentration
parameters.description: Concentration/decision making - rate difficulty concentrating over the past 7 days
options: 0 - No change in usual capacity to concentrate or make decisions
1 - Occasionally feels indecisive or notices that attention wanders
2 - Most of the time struggles to focus attention or make decisions
3 - Cannot concentrate well enough to read or cannot make even minor decisions

parameters.name: self_view
parameters.description: View of myself - rate self-criticism and feelings of guilt over the past 7 days
options: 0 - Sees self as equally worthwhile and deserving as others
1 - Is more self-blaming than usual
2 - Largely believes that he/she causes problems for others
3 - Thinks almost constantly about major and minor defects in self

parameters.name: suicidal_ideation
parameters.description: Thoughts of death or suicide - rate suicidal thoughts over the past 7 days
options: 0 - Does not think of suicide or death
1 - Feels that life is empty or wonders if it's worth living
2 - Thinks of suicide or death several times a week for several minutes
3 - Thinks of suicide or death several times a day in some detail, or has made specific plans or attempted suicide

parameters.name: general_interest
parameters.description: General interest - rate loss of interest in people and activities over the past 7 days
options: 0 - No change from usual level of interest in people and activities
1 - Notices a reduction in former interests/activities
2 - Finds only one or two former interests remain
3 - Has virtually no interest in formerly pursued activities

parameters.name: energy_level
parameters.description: Energy level - rate fatigue and energy over the past 7 days
options: 0 - No change in usual level of energy
1 - Tires more easily than usual
2 - Makes significant personal effort to initiate or maintain usual daily activities
3 - Unable to carry out most of usual daily activities due to lack of energy

parameters.name: psychomotor_slowing
parameters.description: Feeling slowed down - rate psychomotor retardation over the past 7 days
options: 0 - Normal speed of thinking, gesturing, speaking, and moving
1 - Patient notes slowed thinking, and voice tone or speech is slightly retarded
2 - Takes several seconds to respond to questions; reports slowed thinking
3 - Often does not respond to questions without repeated prompting

parameters.name: psychomotor_agitation
parameters.description: Feeling restless - rate psychomotor agitation over the past 7 days
options: 0 - No increased speed or disorganization in thinking or gesturing
1 - Fidgets, wrings hands, and shifts positions
2 - Describes impulse to move about and displays motor restlessness
3 - Unable to stay seated and paces about, or hands shake or tremble

result.name: qids_sr16_score
result.description: QIDS-SR-16 total score indicating depression severity level

ranges.interpretation: No depression present. Score indicates absence of clinically significant depressive symptoms. Continue routine monitoring and maintain current well-being strategies. Consider preventive mental health measures and lifestyle factors that support emotional wellness.

Mild depression. Some depressive symptoms present that may warrant attention. Consider lifestyle interventions, psychoeducation, supportive counseling, and monitoring. May benefit from stress reduction techniques, exercise, and sleep hygiene. Reassess in 2-4 weeks.

Moderate depression. Clinically significant depressive symptoms requiring treatment. Consider psychotherapy (CBT, IPT), medication evaluation, or combination treatment. Monitor for functional impairment and safety concerns. Reassess treatment response regularly.

Severe depression. Significant depressive symptoms requiring immediate attention and treatment. Recommend combination of psychotherapy and medication. Monitor closely for safety concerns including suicidal ideation. Consider psychiatric consultation and intensive treatment planning.

Very severe depression. Requires immediate psychiatric evaluation and intensive treatment. High risk for functional impairment and safety concerns. Consider hospitalization if suicidal risk present. Implement comprehensive treatment plan with close monitoring and family involvement.

references: Rush AJ, Trivedi MH, Ibrahim HM, Carmody TJ, Arnow B, Klein DN, et al. The 16-Item Quick Inventory of Depressive Symptomatology (QIDS), clinician rating (QIDS-C), and self-report (QIDS-SR): a psychometric evaluation in patients with chronic major depression. Biol Psychiatry. 2003 Sep 1;54(5):573-83. doi: 10.1016/s0006-3223(02)01866-8.

Trivedi MH, Rush AJ, Ibrahim HM, Carmody TJ, Biggs MM, Suppes T, et al. The Inventory of Depressive Symptomatology, Clinician Rating (IDS-C) and Self-Report (IDS-SR), and the Quick Inventory of Depressive Symptomatology, Clinician Rating (QIDS-C) and Self-Report (QIDS-SR) in public sector patients with mood disorders: a psychometric evaluation. Psychol Med. 2004 Jan;34(1):73-82. doi: 10.1017/s0033291703001107.

Reilly TJ, MacGillivray SA, Reid IC, Cameron IM. Psychometric properties of the 16-item Quick Inventory of Depressive Symptomatology: a systematic review and meta-analysis. J Psychiatr Res. 2015 Jan;60:132-40. doi: 10.1016/j.jpsychires.2014.09.008.
formula: QIDS-SR-16 Score = Sum of 16 item scores (sleep, mood, appetite/weight, concentration, self-view, suicidal ideation, interest, energy, psychomotor symptoms), with special scoring rules for sleep and appetite/weight domains
notes: 16-item self-report scale assessing depressive symptoms over past 7 days
Each item scored 0-3 points, total range 0-27 points
Covers all 9 DSM-IV depression criterion symptom domains
Special scoring: only highest score counted for sleep items (1-4) and appetite/weight items (6-9)
Sleep domain: use highest score among sleep onset, maintenance, early awakening, hypersomnia
Appetite/weight domain: use highest score among appetite decrease/increase and weight decrease/increase
Total score = items 5 + 10-16 + highest sleep score + highest appetite/weight score
Strong correlation with IDS-SR-30 (r = 0.96-0.97) and HAM-D (r = 0.85-0.86)
Sensitive to treatment change and widely used in clinical trials
Available in multiple formats: self-report, clinician-rated, IVR telephone
Suitable for screening, treatment monitoring, and research applications
Validated in diverse populations including chronic depression, bipolar, medical comorbidities
